newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa PIC gets stakes in ex-Malbak firms.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa PIC gets stakes in ex-Malbak firms.

text.p: Recently unbundled Malbak Ltd said on Wednesday that the Public Investment Commissioners has invested 344.5 million in the offer to Malbak minorities for their shares in the unbundled firms.
Malbak said that all tender offers had been accepted in full.
The PIC now owns 3.9 percent of Ellerine Holdings Ltd, four percent of Foodcorp Ltd, 2.9 percent of New Clicks Holdings Ltd and five percent of South African Druggists Ltd (SAD).
It also has a 1.1 percent investment in the focused packaging firm, Malbak.

The largest absolute amount was the 140.3 million rand invested in SAD followed by 79 million in Ellerines, 63.8 million in Foodcorp and 33.8 million in Clicks. It invested 27.5 million rand in the "new" Malbak.
Jannie Grobbelaar of SMK Securities, the broking firm which facilitated the PIC offer, said it was clear that investors wanted to hold onto their "new" Malbak shares.
"...(They) are excited by the prospect of another packaging company in the sector," he said.
